title: Latin Grammar Fundamentals
description: Master the fundamentals of Latin grammar through an adaptive learning approach. This course covers noun declensions, verb conjugations, and essential vocabulary for reading classical Latin texts.
course_learning_outcomes: Analyze the structure of Latin sentences by identifying the case, number, and function of nouns, pronouns, and adjectives within complex grammatical contexts
Apply knowledge of verb conjugation patterns across all tenses and moods to accurately translate Latin verbs and understand temporal relationships in texts
Evaluate the grammatical function of different sentence elements (subjects, objects, modifiers) to construct accurate translations of classical Latin passages
Create original Latin sentences and short passages that demonstrate mastery of noun declensions, verb conjugations, and syntactic structures
Compare and contrast Latin grammatical structures with English equivalents to deepen understanding of both languages' morphology and syntax
instructional_notes: This course uses Bloom's Taxonomy to scaffold learning from foundational knowledge (Remember/Understand) through higher-order skills (Analyze/Evaluate/Create)
Each module builds systematically on previous concepts - strict prerequisite enforcement recommended
Spaced repetition and cumulative review are integrated to support long-term retention
Diagnostic assessments adapt to learner confidence and correctness for personalized pathways
